page.title: 08Weather
page.content: In winter we experience howling gales from the north and north east blowing across the Pentland Firth. The winds bring rain, hail, sleet and snow that make you wrap up warmly. Temperatures range from 35F to 40F. Occasionally Thurso is cut off because of snow- blocked roads which sometimes close our school. We travel from home to school in the dark because there are only seven hours of daylight. In summer, warmer winds come from the south and south west giving us sunny periods, showers and drizzle. Temperatures are about 55F to 65F. We have long summer days lasting for 20 - 21 hours. The colours of sunrises are peach, yellow and orange while sunset shades vary from tomato red to crimson cerise, magenta and bronze. The clouds show a rosy pink glow and golden lining. We often see double rainbows.
